title: CS 320A MCDU: Metal Craft That Feels Like The Flight Deck
excerpt: How our all-new Airbus MCDU delivers 1:1 scale fidelity with CNC-machined metal and silicone keys.
content:
## Why the 320A Feels Authentic

We start with a full CNC-machined metal chassis so the dimensions, mounting points, and surface finish match the real Airbus unit. Tactile silicone buttons mirror the resistance pilots expect, so you can fly raw data legs or FMS work without adapting muscle memory.

**Quick specs**

- 1:1 enclosure, no exposed fasteners on the front bezel.
- Silicone keycaps molded from the same geometry as the aircraft part number.
- Plug-and-play USB: power and data travel through a single cable, no driver hunt.

Pair it with the pedestal you already own or drop it on a desk and run it with MSFS, X-Plane, or Prepar3D. Explore the full gallery at https://www.cockpit-simulator.com/shop/cs-320a-mcdu/.

title: Why the Daisy Chain Cable Kit Simplifies Multi-Module Setups
excerpt: Bundle power and data for MCDUs, MCPs, and EFIS modules through a single USB path and keep the flight deck tidy.
content:
## Less Cable, More Flying

Our Daisy Chain Cable Kit lets you feed multiple CS peripherals through one USB port so your rig does not need four powered hubs. Each lead locks in place to preserve signal integrity for CDU key matrices and encoder data.

### Typical workflow
1. Connect the hub lead to your PC or powered USB expander.
2. Run the short jumpers between adjacent CS modules (MCP, EFIS, CDU, etc.).
3. Label the order so you can reassemble the same chain after events or transport.

The result is a cockpit stack that travels easily and keeps EMI noise off your desk. Grab the kit here: https://www.cockpit-simulator.com/shop/daisy-chain-cables-kit/.

title: 737X MCP + EFIS: Building a Complete Mode Control Stack
excerpt: Combine the CS 737X MCP, EFIS, and desktop stand options to recreate the NG glare shield workflow at home.
content:
## Why Pair MCP and EFIS

The MCP handles A/P mode logic while the dual EFIS units feed your navigation displays. Our 1:1 housings use engineering plastics, custom molds (17 for MCP, 6 for EFIS), and laser-etched legends so the detents and brightness lines feel right.

### Setup checklist
- Mount MCP centered on the stand or your custom glare shield.
- Add EFIS units on both sides, wired through the Daisy Chain Cable Kit to minimize USB ports.
- Run lighting and functional tests with your preferred 737 suite before the next online event.

Dive into the hardware galleries: https://www.cockpit-simulator.com/cs-737x-mcp/ and https://www.cockpit-simulator.com/cs-737x-efis/.
